So, after a lot of reading regarding reviews etc. I decided to go for another Motorola  -  the G34 5G. in the hopes that it would be more efficient and useful feature wise than my old e5 Play.Best move I made  -  this phone is packed with features I never new existed, is so logical and easy to navigate. The touch screen is super sensitive, responds immediately, and moving from one function to another is very fast. Nice bright screen, colours are very rich, and text is very clear. Sound is loud enough in my opinion, and does not have a "tinny" tone.  love the larger keypad on this  -  always had a problem with the much  smaller one on the old e5 Play, so only ever used it when I had to. It is now a pleasure to send texts, and all so simple and easy.Phone was very quick and simple to set up (once all the usual Google claptrap was out of the way) All very idiot proof. Imported all my data re emails, contacts etc. without having to do anything  -  all quite idiot proof really.Connected to my wifi at once. The only issue I had was trying to find out where the sim card tray was!! Could not see where there was a slot anywhere on the side of the phone that  was indicated on the instruction sheet. After almost giving up and putting  it back in the box, I realised there was a clear gel cover on the back which was hiding the location of the sim tray  (hello!!) Bit fiddly getting the nano card in, but once it was done, it was all just ready to go.I have had it for about two weeks now, and have monitored the battery life  -  it is very good. Leaving it switched on all day until late evening, with average useage, I have only had to recharge it 3 times as yet. I had to get a plug adapter (comes with a 2  pin plug on the usb lead. It does a rapid charge in approx 40 mins to fully charge from around 30%.Cameras work well - takes really clear pics with good colour. Video with sound works well too. Macro feature is very good, and useful that is has a qr scanner too. Had to download an app for that on the other phone. Easy to hold and not heavy or cumbersome.I never seemed to form a relationship with my old phone - always treated it as a necessary evil really and preferred my pay as you go Doro phone. However, with this phone I can honestly say I really love it and wish I had made the move a few yeas ago. I enjoy using this phone, it does not cause me any  hassle, responds quickly and efficiently to commands, and is just so great in every way. For what is considered as a budget phone, it does all I need it to and more, so why pay hundreds of pounds for a "non budget" phone. I consider this phone an absolute bargain at this  price for what you are getting.Cannot comment on face/fingerprint recognition because I have not got those features  set up. I did change the clock icon on the hoe screen because it was so big!! Downloaded K-9 email app (Mozilla thunderbird) and it configured and set up my email quickly, and works just great.  I do not like or use gmail.I would highly recommend this  to anyone wanting a  decent phone without the high price tag  -  ideal for a youngster's first phone even. Well done Moto. Very happy customer.

oui, c'est surprenant et c'est gavant de me dire que je choisis toujours des smartphone avec des puces qui chauffe pourtant je ne joue pas et je ne suis pas un power user, rien que prendre quelques photos ou t√©l√©charger des applications sur le playstore il commence d√©j√† a chauffer, pareil si on reste un peu longtemps en appels, mouais.- La captation 5G aurais pu √™tre meilleur, les d√©bits sont pas "super √©lev√©" (j'ai essayer sur la m√™me antenne a des heures diff√©rents) j'ai atteint 700 grand max (sur un MI 13T PRO j'avais plus d'1Gb/s)- Pixel UI (l'interface) est pas si folle que √ßa...je m'attendais CLAIREMENT a mieux et je me disais que je ne pourrais pas √™tre d√©√ßu au vue de ce que j'avais vue en vid√©o cependant c'est la que je voie qu'au final c'est super important de choisir son interface et pas de se dire d'√©couter un quelconque fanboy sur un r√©seau social qui va vous dire que Pixel c'est "incroyable, fluide, simple et efficace, customisable avec des photos parfaite" car....non ?C'est vide, fade, on a la sensation d'avoir clairement une surcouche stock avec peu de retouche et des manques de fonctions utiles que je comprend pas trop la logique de Google sur ce point la, clairement on a la sensation d'avoir une interface qui veux tellement faire "√©pur√©" qu'elle se trompe elle m√™me sur sa direction et on en oublie des points pratique/essentiel, j'ai √©t√© √©tonn√© de voir que je n'aime absolument pas la surcouche (bien qu'elle soit pas pire que celle de Xiaomi, n'abusons pas non plus)- L'always on Display n'est pas customisable...genre...OUI VOUS AVEZ BIEN LU ! sur le MI 13 T PRO je rechargeait le smartphone de 0 √† 100% en  30 minutes et le chargeur √©t√© fournis ! j'avais fait √ßa pendant 1 an et la batterie n'avais rien eu, aucune d√©gradation ! donc l'excuse du "oui mais la recharge super rapide √ßa d√©grade ni√©ni√©ni√© !" c'est un peu du bullsh*t !- Les boutons de navigations (oui car je d√©teste la navigation par geste) sont m√™me pas customisable et donc forc√©ment comme j'ai eu Samsung et Xiaomi bah je n'ai pas l'habitude et...ils sont invers√© :)Qu'elle merveilleuse logique d'inverser les boutons retour/multit√¢che, rappelant qu'on est sur un smartphone "Original by Google"- Mais √ßa s'arr√™te pas la dans l'originalit√© ! Viele Konkurrenten sehen schon verwaschen und schwammig aus, wo das Pixel noch scharf ist - insbesondere auch beim Hineinzoomen. Manchen Menschen ist das vielleicht zu unlnat√ºrlich. Klar, das menschliche Auge hat seine Grenzen. In meinen Augen ist die Realit√§t aber nicht unscharf, nur weil sie weiter weg von einem ist. Gerade der ist in den Pixeltestes oft eher m√§√üig bis schlecht bewertet worden. Mit dem Pixel 8 kam ich trotzdem gut √ºber den Tag. Gef√ºhlt h√§lt der Akku 1,5 mal so lange, wie beim Pixel 8, obwohl das Display minimal gr√∂√üer ist und der Akku nur um 125 mAh auf 4.700 mAh gewachsen ist. Scheinbar hat Google hier deutlich an der Effizienz und ggf. auch Akkuverwaltung gearbeitet.Induktives Laden ist eine praktische Funktion, die beispielsweise beim Laden im Auto helfen kann: Dank kabelloser Datenverbindung ist so im Auto generell kein Kabel mehr n√∂tig. Ich werfe das Auto beim Einsteigen vor l√§ngeren Fahrten in die Ablage und habe direkt beim Starten eine Datenverbindung und die Aufrechterhaltung des Akkus (wirklich voll zu laden klappt meistens nicht, weil die Ladeleistung daf√ºr dann doch zu gering ist). I will go over all the cons first, then the pros. I don't like some of the apps they installed (also known as bloatware) and forced ads I have to watch to use them, & almost all of them I can't delete, only force stop them. There isn't a huge amount of them, but some.  I would not mind the bloatware in the phone as long as I can get rid of what I don't want, which isn't the case as they locked them. This is nonsense & although many companies do this practice it's always a negative. Instead of having the fingerprint on the touch screen it's on the power button on this phone. Due to it's very narrow width it's flaky at best to get it to read your fingerprint where it's mostly useless as it is much quicker just to enter your passcode. Also if you press to hard since it's also the power button trying to read your print it will put the screen out on you. This overall is a bad idea. Although the auto adaptive brightness is on by default I noticed it is brighter than desired so I have to manually adjust it frequently, but this is a matter of preference for me. The google widget is locked to it's position on home screen & totally unmovable or removable which is extremely irritating to me as I don't want it. It is frustrating that they lock stuff in this manner. Please let me be very clear I am not throwing this phone under the bus here, but rather pointing out some extremely important things that Umidigi needs to be aware of. The improvements made from the knowledge of these things we consumers aren't happy with is important for them. Now, lets get to the pros of this phone. Storage is awesome with 128G internal and expandable micro SD slot for even more, and the 6 gig of ram is very nice. Price for this phone for it's features is great! 50 megapixel camera does a very nice job, even has a macro that works well, and in the included photo you can see very good depth of field focus from foreground all the way to the back ground. Although I haven't done a lot of photo play with this yet I can assure all of you it's very good for it's price point. I done a couple of tests of game play (see photos) & although not a light speed device it does well. Normal use of apps, scrolling & pulling up web pages is very fast so it's great for me. Comes complete with screen protector & case already to go, but I will say the case is minimal for any protection for the phone as it is pretty thin & more plastic like & very little grip to your hand if your hands are dry, but fits perfectly so to be included is very cool! All settings work pretty well & although Android 14 like my other phone it is different in the user interface in some things that can get one a little out of whack to find some things shall we say. Power/volume up/down are on the right and work great with the case, & it also has a hotkey button on the left you can assign something specific to which is very nice. Love the 3.5mm jack plus the fact it's on the top of the phone. Just a personal preference but it's always in my way if it were to be on bottom of the phone in my opinion. Many phones now don't have that capability so it's a plus in my mind. Sound is very adequate also for it's speaker & ok for me. I plugged it in to power before I even turned it on for the first time and it had 100% battery in the phone. I installed my sim card and micro SD card before first power on & it took off perfectly & google easily took care of loading all of my apps from other phone doing the type C to type C phone to phone connection. Included also is a 15W charger W/type C to type C cable so you will have cable out of the box needed for transferring files to it from old phone. Very thoughtful of them to do this. Being totally unlocked for any carrier is a huge plus for sure, but just a word of note my Boost sim W/AT&T service cranked up and worked like a champ. Screen resolution quality & size is awesome! There are also some themes installed that are very nice too, & there are 6 of them. If you are in the market for a very good 5G phone with a lot of goodies/features for it's price then grab you one of these phones. I do highly recommend it!

Io sono invece un giovane (di anni 19) che ha deliberatamente voluto abbandonare il mondo social, internet e quanto. Tuttavia ad oggi non avere modo di comunicare con familiari e amici (anche lontani) √® impensabile, dunque mi serviva un telefonino basilare per fare il minimo indispensabile. Fra le varie opzioni, ho scelto questo. Dunque questa recensione non √® fatta da un anziano o per un anziano, ma vi parler√≤ di come un ‚Äúgen z proselito‚Äù si trova con questo piccolo gioiellino.Anzitutto, il primissimo pregio non da poco: appena arrivato ho preso il mio vecchio smartphone, ho tolto la mia SIM Vodafone ultra recente, l'ho inserita in questo ttfone; inserita la batteria l'ho acceso: la SIM funziona senza alcun problema. Nulla di scontato: provando altri vecchi telefonini in casa, non la leggevano neppure. Molto bene.Ricezione del segnale? Pare magica. Lo smartphone che ho lasciato √® pur vero che non era da quattro soldi, dunque anche quello non aveva particolari problemi; tuttavia io vivo in una dimora dagli spessi muri, e i moderni smartphone un po' meno costosi dei miei familiari prendono solo se ci si mette all'esterno. All'interno non si pu√≤ parlare al telefono, non prende. Invece questo ttfone dell'effimero prezzo di euro 20 prende ovunque in casa. Incredibile.Gli sms vengono inviati molto velocemente; certo nulla di paragonabile all'istantaneo di un'app simile a whatsapp, ma si parala comunque dai 3 ai 6/7 secondi, in base al numero dei caratteri.La tastiera √® comodissima e permette una digitazione particolarmente veloce. Molto meglio rispetto ad altri telefoni a tasti di euro 40 o superiori (parlo per esperienza).Oltre ad avere spazio per due SIM, √® presente un ulteriore spazio per una micro sd.Il telefonino legge perfettamente i file .mp3, dunque se vi serve un piccolo lettore √® anche perfetto. Un motivo per il quale non ho dato la 5¬∞ stella √® per√≤ che, nonostante i file inviati tramite bluetooth (unico modo) funzionino alla perfezione, si √® obbligati ad ascoltarli dall'inizio e fino alla fine; o meglio, naturalmente si pu√≤ saltare alla canzone successiva e/o ascoltare la precedente, ma non v'√® alcun modo di portare avanti o indietro la traccia in ascolto. Poco male per le canzoni da pochi minuti; se invece ascoltate un podcast e vi perdete una parola, o vi accontentate di averla persa (come del resto si fa come quando si ascolta dal vivo) oppure dovrete ascoltare tutto da capo. √à possibile organizzare in cartelle, tuttavia non √® presente nessuna funzione "taglia" (o"sposta") nel file manager; sar√† dunque necessario, dopo aver creato la cartella, copiarvi il file all'interno ed eliminare poi l'originale.√à possibile collegare auricolari/cuffie bluetooth. Io utilizzo le mie cuffie di buona qualit√† ed il suono non √® affatto troncato, esce pulitissimo.Il telefonino √® anche dotato di una radio FM, una vera, e non una web radio. Sulla carta pu√≤ prendere le stazioni anche senza un'antenna collegata, ma in pratica a meno che il segnale non sia pressoch√© perfetto, non funziona. Anche qui poco male, alla fine basta un paio di auricolari col cavo, o anche solo un cavo jack2jack classico.Il suono della cassa incorporata √® semplicemente accettabile. Si sente bene, si distinguono bene le parole dell'interlocutore in chiamata, ma nulla di eccezionale. Se si collegano delle cuffie con microfono si pu√≤ usare sia per sentire sia per farsi sentire nettamente meglio.La fotocamera √® un motivo per dare e per togliere una stella. Le foto che fa sono anch'esse al limite dell'accettabile: e per√≤ bisogna considerare che taluni smartphone da euro 100/120 fanno scatti ben peggiori. Tuttavia, il telefonino mi permette di fare una (una!) singola foto, e dopo averla salvata, √® impossibile aprire la fotocamera perch√© si blocca sempre. Talvolta basta un riavvio, talvolta no. Insomma, la fotocamera potrebbe funzionare, e quando funziona non √® malaccio; ma funziona solo quando gli gira bene!Inviandosi una foto tramite bluetooth (o utilizzandone una scattata, se siete sotto una buona stella e vi funziona) si pu√≤ anche modificare lo sfondo. Stella in meno perch√©, nonostante le dimissioni abbastanza ridotte del display, non √® possibile eseguire lo zoom.C'√® un solo giochino che segue le orme di Candy crush (per esempio).La batteria? Talvolta mi dimentico pure che vada a batteria! Pare infinita. Pare, eh! Dopo un po', anche se dopo un po' di giorni, va ricaricato! e che ricarica! Questo perch√© √® davvero molto piccolo, e un anziano con problemi di vista e/o di impugnatura, temo farebbe fatica. I am not a heavy user, mostly messaging, discord etc, and a bit of browsing, and I am running at about 52 minutes per 1% of battery! Thats pretty good for me!The camera is not amazing, I am a photographer so I dont expect any phone cam to be, I use my DSLR for photography and like probably 99% of people the phone camera is used for nothing more than snaps that are shared over messengers and faceache etc, for that purpose the camera is way more than adequate, its has 4 zoom levels and of course pinch and zoom right in.. even zoomed fully the images are good enough for the typical use. No complaints from me.The audio quality (speaker) is a bit lacking, but again its a ¬£240 smart phone not a ¬£1200 samsung, its not TERRIBLE but I have definitely heard better, and with headphones the sound is fine for my non hifi snobby ears, and who really listens to music without headphones anyway?The fingerprint reader appears to be on the ball, not had any failures, and its fast!.. the face recognition even faster, thats pretty much instant if you unlock the phone with face in view of the cam.***MEMORY*** there is information in the answers here that it does not have an sd card slot, well when I went to put in my sim there is an sd card space in the carrier and when I drop my 256gb sd in that the phone has all my photos and music on it and it tells me that there is a 256gb sd card installed and available, so I think that answer is not entirely correct :D I am quite happy I have 768gb now instead of the 512gb I thought I was getting XDAll in all its definitely a good value for money purchase, I can speak for the longevity of course, but I have had no issues with anything as yet. Its not as polished as a galaxy of course, but its polished enough for me, it does everything I need it to do, the battery life is good, and it is a fraction of the cost of the big boys flagships. I am more than happy I broke away from the big names.
Read more'}]

Exceptional.Battery is at 96% health as seen in pics.My only real issue that has caused me a headache is the 64GB storage, not enough to take on the iPhone X, and because my phone was so badly damaged I couldn‚Äôt remove things to get that memory down.However, I did it a different way, time consuming but has worked out pretty okay. My iPad is pretty much a clone of my phone, so did a full iCloud backup of iPad, had to increase iCloud storage so that‚Äôs now ¬£2.99 a month. But I was already paying for 50GB, so in reality it‚Äôs an extra cost of ¬£2 a month.Then I asked the iPhone SE to restore from iCloud, because all the photos are compressed this is now taking up 40GB on the iPhone SE. if you need a picture in full HD resolution you just click the cloud button and it will retrieve it for you.Also offloaded apps unlikely to be used on phone, makes them a couple of MB but all the data is saved in the cloud, so at any point you can pull it back. So this has been a solution.It ported in the apps, the passwords, I configured email so that‚Äôs all there, messenger was just a log in and its put all that on there. Whatsapp was a case of logging in and thats all gone on, the only thing it hasn‚Äôt gone on is contacts. Going to try and find a way to do this later on. If I have to do manually it will be a bit of an ache as about 400+ names and numbers to add!It did want an update to OS 16.6, not a problem, 30 min job.Not put sim in just yet, getting the whole thing fully set up first on Wi-Fi, sim will be last to go in at the end of today.Of course, you can spend more money and get 256GB phone and it will just clone itself. But that‚Äôs going to be ¬£¬£¬£ more.This way I should be up and running by end of the day for ¬£119 - express delivery and to my eye a phone that looks new, with excellent condition battery. Plus I‚Äôve ordered an extra tough case for it, so the ‚Äúculprit‚Äù can‚Äôt do a repeat performance, so even if there were some fine scratches / signs of wear, they would be covered by casing anyway.So far so good, will be relived when sim is in, that‚Äôs the final step to make and receive calls.Highly recommend, just be mindful that 64GB is quite low storage these days, but as explained above, there is a way around that.A cost effective solution to a desperate situation that needed an emergency replacement. I‚Äôm also lead to believe ‚ÄúWikipedia‚Äù that the A13 chip in the SE 2020 is an improvement on the X.Also, this is the fastest item I‚Äôve ever had delivered bar a takeaway, and I live in the Channel Islands. Well impressed with delivery! Impressed with condition of phone ‚Äúlike new‚Äù and impressed at that great battery health.I was so distressed after the kitten pulled apart my iPhone X, and worried about replacement costs. I‚Äôm so relieved this option existed and hasn‚Äôt broke the bank.Think I‚Äôm converted to going down the refurbished route in the future, the savings are huge!Many thanks to the seller! 5******

Il sensore di luminosit√† √® reattivo e ben tarato, cos√¨ come l'accelerometro e il sensore di prossimit√† che funziona bene in chiamata e anche con app per accendere/sbloccare lo schermo senza passare dal tasto fisico.Il touchscreen √® anch'esso ben calibrato e preciso e difficilmente perde un tocco.L'interfaccia proprietaria Doke OS 2.1, basata su Android 11, si presenta semplice, leggera, intuitiva e oltre alle solite app di Google, offre:- il trasferimento dei dati personali da e verso un altro dispositivo;- un gestore di sistema con cui pulire la memoria, ottimizzare i consumi, e controllare vari settaggi delle app;- la modalit√† bambino che fungendo da parental control, limita il tempo di utilizzo dello smartphone, l'uso delle app e dei dati;- il "congelatore" per ibernare le app che si usano meno o che magari tendono a restare in background, risparmiando cos√¨ batteria.Non ci sono bloatware e ancora meno pubblicit√† di alcun genere.Non mancano altre funzioni secondarie come: la luminosit√† notturna per non affaticare la vista al buio, la modalit√† a una mano indicata prima, registrare la schermata o fare screenshot, la possibilit√† di splittare lo schermo, registrare la conversazione durante la chiamata, la navigazione tramite gesti.La ricezione del segnale √® buona, in chiamata si sente bene, la navigazione in 4g non d√† problemi, wi-fi, bluetooth e audio funzionano ugualmente bene.Se la cpu quad-core in fase di acquisto mi era sembrata una delle parti maggiormente di compromesso per contenere il prezzo, in realt√† mi sono dovuto ricredere perch√© pur senza eccessi, senza effetti wow, fa comunque girare bene e in modo abbastanza fluido tutto il sistema, senza grossi impuntamenti o blocchi critici, senza dare problemi nel normale utilizzo quotidiano. Questo √® probabilmente uno di quei prodotti da regalare ad un genitore che non necessita di chisss√† quali funzioni e prestazioni oppure al proprio figlio in tenera et√† per consentirgli di iniziare ad utilizzare questo tipo di strumento con il minimo della spesa.Lo smartphone esteticamente si presenta bene e, secondo me, si ispira come design a quello di altri marchi pi√π popolari. A me personalmente la squadratura netta dei bordi non piace ma √® un gusto strettamente personale. Apprezzo di pi√π un design con linee molto pi√π smussate. Per il resto nulla da dire. Nonostante il prezzo estremamente economico fa la sua figura sotto questo aspetto. Potrebbe sembrare tranquillamente un prodotto di fascia superiore rispetto al prezzo proposto.Sulla confezione (soprattutto), cos√¨ come nelle caratteristiche tecniche, troviamo in bella vista il quantitativo di memoria messo a disposizione ossia 128GB per lo storage ed "8" GB di RAM per poi leggere molto pi√π in piccolo la dicitura 4+4. Questo smartphone non ha 8GB di RAM, ne ha solo 4 effettivi. Gli altri 4 li "recupera", se decidiamo nelle impostazioni di abilitare questa funzione, allocando, sullo storage interno, dello spazio che viene riservato a poter essere utilizzato da parte del sistema come RAM aggiuntiva. Questa √® una "furbata", se posso permettermi, molto pi√π a favore di marketing che del reale funzionamento di questo "escamotage". Di base qualunque tipo di memoria diversa da una RAM non avr√† mai neanche lontanamente la velocit√† della RAM. Questo di base. Se poi crediamo veramente che in uno smartphone economico con la parte storage che, sicuramente gi√† di suo non avr√† chip con possibilit√† di transfer elevati per poter contenere il pi√π possibile i costi, deve fare le veci di RAM di sistema in supplemento affinch√© ci sia un aumento ipotetico delle prestazioni, √® pura fantasia. Ripeto che scrivere che lo smartphone ha 8GB di RAM non √® corretto. Riportare in piccolo la dicitura 4+4 ci fa capire come in realt√† stanno le cose. Allocare spazio sulla parte storage in uno smartphone del genere sperando che funzioni come la RAM non ha, a mio avviso, alcun senso se non per pure finalit√† di marketing e pubblicit√†.Accendendo lo smartphone ed iniziando la configurazione risaltano subito altri due elementi, uno in positivo e l'altro purtroppo in negativo. Quello positivo √® lo schermo. Su questo punto sono rimasto abbastanza colpito. Nonostante sia un 720x1600 con 520nits di luminosit√† devo dire che la qualit√† √® molto buona. I 90Hz purtroppo non li vedo nel senso che rispetto al mio Realme 8 Pro non noto alcuna differenza sullo scroll delle immagini o del testo che su 90Hz dovrebbe risultare pi√π fluido a livello visivo e con minor effetto di trascinamento. Non ho percepito differenze. La qualit√† del dettaglio invece √® buona se consideriamo il target e la fascia di prezzo dello smartphone. Ho provato sia a leggere che a vedere un p√≤ di video su Youtube e sembra incredibile ma sia in termini di qualit√† del dettaglio che fedelt√† sui colori, mi √® sembrato davvero buono. Contrasto, colori e luminosit√† sono pi√π che accettabili. Mi aspettavo uno schermo pi√π buio con colori scialbi ed invece non √® cos√¨. Su questo aspetto mi posso esprimere sicuramente in modo positivo.L'altro elemento invece che si evidenzia in modo negativo √® che lo smartphone non ha possibilit√† di connettersi a reti wifi 5Ghz. Come detto prima, questo elemento tecnico ad un certo tipo di persone a cui pu√≤ essere destinato un prodotto come questo pu√≤ non interessare. Ed in effetti anche connettendolo alla rete wifi 2,4Ghz di casa (FTTH di Fastweb), lo smartphone sul web viaggia piuttosto bene. Dove invece si nota di pi√π questo limite a livello di connettivit√† e quindi di velocit√† di navigazione pi√π ridotta √® su Youtube. I video vengono caricati di base a 360p e quindi in bassa risoluzione. Forzando la qualit√† superiore, funziona senza problemi ma sui video diventano un p√≤ pi√π evidenti i limiti di questo smartphone che si traducono in latenze maggiori e reattivit√† pi√π ridotta. Tende a bufferizzare e quindi a rispondere qualche istante dopo il comando che viene impartito come pu√≤ essere l'avanzamento veloce sul video o anche passare dalla visualizzazione verticale a quella orizzontale. Il telefono produce dei lag ma nulla di intollerabile. Ho trovato la cosa assolutamente normale e in una misura che non rende l'utilizzo dello smartphone penalizzante o frustrante.Sempre in termini di connettivit√†, la velocit√† rilevata sulla stessa rete wifi (sempre la 2,4GHz) da parte di questo smartphone rispetto al mio Realme 8 Pro √® praticamente la met√†. This was the painful part.Transferring data from my iPhone 11 was not the easiest of tasks and I had to take an update to the fifteen before it would initiate the transfer process.However Once completed my new phone was near identical in appearance and usability apart from one or two apps that required setting up again.The Home Screen is large, bright and colourful is blessed with something called the Dynamic island which alters its size and shape dependent on the app that requires it.This is a great feature introduced to recent Apple phones and transforms the viewing experience when watching content playback of the likes  of Prime, Netflix, Disney etc.It is finally a really enjoyable viewing experience now the dreaded notch has gone.Some have mentioned a lower refresh rate on this model compared to the Pro models but is not a noticeable problem for me.Not just watching but the Sound quality even at low volumes is brilliant particularly when watching movies.Watch Blade Runner 2049 or rather listen to it on the Apple app is a totally immersive experience even without AirPods.Officer K‚Äôs visit to the Wallace Corporation‚Äôs Earth Headquarters has great depth and echo as he exchanges dialogue with the file clerk and Luv in its large halls.iOS 17 standby mode is slightly disappointing down to the exclusivity of the pro models only having an always on display. But this is the only real disappointment of this model.The ability to plug in USB devices and exchange data or charge or receive power from other devices is a real step forward.Battery life is phenomenal. End of!Doesn‚Äôt get hot when charging and lasts ages. Unless you have got it glued to your face you can expect a couple of days between charges for average use and when the battery is new of course.I have some older wireless chargers that are struggling a bit to charge through the mag safe case with the phone attached.This hasn‚Äôt been an issue before with my other phones. I haven‚Äôt got a new type mag safe charger yet and is not really a phone issueThe camera has several new features including automatically picking out portraits without specifically switching to portrait mode.It has a up to 48 mega pixel camera and with iOS 17 can produce bokeh effect portraits.There are some brilliant video modes including a live action sports type mode.4K or HD recording and frame rate adjustment.
Read more'}]
